title: Chord: 13th in C# (Shape: G)
content:
# Chord: 13th in C# (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
The 13th chord in C# with the G shape is a rich and complex chord that adds color and depth to music. It consists of the root note C#, the major third E#, the perfect fifth G#, the dominant seventh note B#, and the thirteenth note A#. This chord has a jazzy and sophisticated sound that can add a lush and harmonically rich flavor to your music.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (C#)
- Major Third (E#)
- Perfect Fifth (G#)
- Dominant Seventh (B#)
- Thirteenth (A#)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 13th chord in C# with the G shape is commonly used in jazz, funk, and R&B genres. It adds a sophisticated and colorful flair to music, creating a sense of tension and release with its complex harmonies. This chord is often used in more complex and advanced musical compositions to enhance the harmonic richness of the music.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 13th chord in C# with the G shape:
1. "So What" by Miles Davis
2. "I Wish" by Stevie Wonder
3. "Chameleon" by Herbie Hancock

These songs showcase how the 13th chord in C# with the G shape can be used to create a lush and harmonically rich sound in different musical contexts.
